title: The Sceptical Chymist
author: The Sceptical Chymist
content: Generally I don't have one eye on bitcoin's price all day long, but I do check it on preev at least once a day and have been relying on the site for years.It's been down for at least a day and a half, with this image popping up when I go to the site:I did do a search on the forum for any info about this before starting this thread.  I may have missed it if there's a discussion going on or if it was just mentioned, so please forgive me if that's the case.Anyone know anything about what's up with preev?

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Apparently preev.com is down right now.Do we really need preev.com in order to check the current Bitcoin price? You could just google "Bitcoin" and the Bitcoin price comes up as the first search result. There are hundreds of places where we could check the current BTC price, most of them are cryptocurrency exchange platforms. I used to check preev.com every day in the past few years, but nowadays I don't care that much about the Bitcoin price, mostly because every price drop is very annoying to me.  I really hope that preev.com comes back online. This website has sentimental value for me and probably for most Bitcoiners.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: davis196 on July 11, 2022, 05:52:56 AMDo we really need preev.com in order to check the current Bitcoin price? You could just google "Bitcoin" and the Bitcoin price comes up as the first search result. I don't use preev, but Google's price ticker for BTC is actually just using Coinbase's price internally (same for all cryptocurrencies). And generally the price on each exchange is going to be different depending on the trading volume, so that's why people are clamoring about preev right now, because that's apparently the reference they have agreed among themselves to use.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on July 11, 2022, 05:46:15 AMxhomerx10 also mentioned this like 2-3 days ago on the WO thread.DOH!!  Well, the search function on this forum leaves a lot to be desired, and I don't think you can do forum-wide searches for things but instead have to search in specific boards.  When I searched, it was in Bitcoin Discussion because that's where I thought any mention of preev might occur--and I was wrong, and apparently I created this thread in the wrong section because it got moved to Service Discussion (which I find odd, but I'm a retard).Quote from: davis196 on July 11, 2022, 05:52:56 AMDo we really need preev.com in order to check the current Bitcoin price? Definitely not in 2022, but if you've got it bookmarked like I do, it's quicker than doing a Google search or having some other site that displays the price bookmarked, because preev's only purpose is to do just that, and it's a very simple and unbloated site.  Besides, at this point it's a bit of a nostalgia thing for me.  I've been using the site for years.  And remember, it's only been in the last few years that you could find bitcoin's price shown on tons of financial websites.  That didn't used to be the case.OK, thanks for the replies.  Gonna lock it up now.
